articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter from Iranian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter from Iranian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory letter from Mansour Chavoshi, Iranian ambassador to the DPRK, on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They were handed on Wednesday to an official concerned by the Iranian ambassador.

articles.title: February 16 Science and Technology Prize Conferred on Scientists, Technicians and Other Persons of Merit
articles.content:
February 16 Science and Technology Prize Conferred on Scientists, Technicians and Other Persons of Merit
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The February 16 Science and Technology Prize was conferred on the scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers and officials in the DPRK.
					  They made tangible contributions to the development of the country's science and technology, building an economic power and improving the people's living standard.
					
					 Certificates and medals of the prize were awarded to various units including the Mathematics Faculty of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology and the Heat Engineering Institute of the State Academy of Science. 
					
					 Certificates of the Scientific and Technological Innovation Prize were awarded to the Organic Chemistry Institute of the Hamhung Branch, the Central Experimental Analysis Institute and the Mathematics Institute of the State Academy of Sciences and the Academy of Koryo Medical Science.
					
					Certificates of the February 16 Science and Technology Prize and the Scientific and Technological Innovation Prize went to more than 90 scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers and officials including Myong Kum Chol, department head of Kim Il Sung University, Kang Yong Chol, room chief of the Rakwon Building Machine Design Institute at the Rakwon Machine Complex, and Mun Chang Won, teacher at Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					ã€€An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Choe Sang Gon, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, officials concerned, scientists, technicians and officials.

articles.title: State Academic Degrees, Titles Awarded to Intellectuals in DPRK
articles.content:
State Academic Degrees, Titles Awarded to Intellectuals in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Intellectuals were awarded the state academic degrees and titles on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Kim Song Gun, researcher of the Turf Institute of the State Academy of Sciences, and Kim Kwon Mu, researcher of the Forest of Economic Value Research Institute of the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation, were awarded the title of academician and that of candidate academician went to Kim Song Il, dean of a faculty of Kim Il Sung University. 
					
					 Jo Chol, vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, Pak Je Dong, room chief of University of National Economy, Ri Kyong Su, researcher of Kim Chaek University of Technology, and others were awarded academic title of professor.
					
					 A doctor's degree went to 38 persons including Yun Nam, head of a department of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Ryong Hwa, head of a department of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Ryom Song Chol, researcher of the Mathematics Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences, and academic title of associate professor went to 127 others.
					
					 They have made great contributions to building a thriving nation by waging a dynamic drive for pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology, true to the dear respected Kim Jong Un's idea of giving importance to science and technology.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.

articles.title: Tour of Paektusan Secret Camp under Way in DPRK
articles.content:
Tour of Paektusan Secret Camp under Way in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The study tour of the Paektusan Secret Camp is under way in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea with the approach of the Day of the Shining Star (Feb. 16), the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Taking part in the tour are servicepersons, school youth and children and other people of different social strata.
					
					 The camp is the place where the headquarters of the Korean revolution was located and the main unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by President Kim Il Sung conducted its anti-Japanese armed struggle in the latter half of the 1930s. It is also the birthplace of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Some days ago, oath-taking meetings were held before Kim Jong Il's old home in the camp by men and officers of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and employees under the Ministry of Railways.
					
					 And publicity officials of frontrunner primary organizations under the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League began their study tour of the camp.
					
					 Preserved in the camp are historic relics related to the childhood of Kim Jong Il, who was born as the son of guerillas.
					
					 The camp helps enhance visitors' pride in being members of the Korean nation blessed with illustrious leaders through generations. Through the study tour of it, those visitors harden their will to carry into accomplishment the revolutionary cause of Juche, united closely around the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Paektusan Secret Camp has been visited by millions of local people, overseas and south Koreans and foreigners since it was restored to the original state and opened to public on February 11, Juche 76 (1987).

articles.title: Tele-Education Gains in Scope in DPRK
articles.content:
Tele-Education Gains in Scope in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Tele-education College under Kim Chaek University of Technology is playing a key role in education among factory colleges in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The college was founded in January Juche 95 (2006) as a tele-education centre, the first of its kind in the country.
					
					 Promoted to a college in March 2010, it has given lectures in 20 odd subjects to more than one hundred industrial establishments throughout the country, including the Chollima Steel Complex and the Hukryong Coal Mine.
					
					 In Pyongyang City alone, tens of factories benefit from the lectures. Among them are the Pyongyang Wheat Flour Processing Factory and the Pyongyang Electric Cable Factory 326.
					
					 Kim Il Nam, rector of the college, told KCNA:
					
					 "The tele-education service makes contributions to training workers to be technicians and reeducating field engineers.
					
					 In recent years the college has won certificates of new scientific and technological findings, inventions, software copyrights and programs, more than 150 in all.
					
					 It also introduced several new state standards and published various kinds of reference books.
					
					 The college, which began operation with ten odd programmers and teachers, has tens of academic degree holders at present."

articles.title: Koreans' Traditional Custom on Lunar New Year's Day
articles.content:
Koreans' Traditional Custom on Lunar New Year's Day
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- From olden times, the Koreans have enjoyed the lunar New Year's Day as one of the biggest holidays in a year.
					 The lunar New Year's Day falls on February 10 this year.
					
					 In this regard, KCNA met Kong Myong Song, director of the Folklore Institute under the DPRK Academy of Social Sciences.
					
					 Kong said:
					
					 "It is a custom of the Koreans to make bows to elders and enjoy traditional dishes and folk games on the lunar New Year's Day.
					
					 The dishes for the day include rice dumpling soup, glutinous rice-cake, steamed rice-cake, pancake, sweets, fruit punch, sweet rice drink and roast. Typical of them is rice dumpling soup.
					
					 Folk games include yut-game, seesawing, top spinning and kite-flying.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Korean people would decorate their gates or sliding doors with pictures of ten long-living animals and things. Courtyards and village roads are lit by various types of lanterns."

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Holding High Slogan "A-match-for-a-hundred" Forever
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Holding High Slogan "A-match-for-a-hundred" Forever
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Today marks the lapse of 50 years since President Kim Il Sung visited a forefront army post on Mt. Taedok and put up the revolutionary slogan "A-match-for-a-hundred".
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in an editorial:
					
					 The President's advancement of militant slogan "A-match-for-a-hundred" marked a historic event as it brought about a radical turn in strengthening the Korean People's Army (KPA) into invincible revolutionary armed forces and building powerful strength for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					  The five decades of the history of Korean revolution since the slogan "A-match-for-a-hundred" was put up are glorious years in which the validity and vitality of the slogan have been fully demonstrated.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of the illustrious commanders of Mt. Paektu, the KPA has grown to be an army strong in ideology and faith as it fights for the party and revolution, the country and its people at the risk of life and an invincible revolutionary army equipped with latest offensive and defensive means.
					
					 The KPA reliably defended the security of the country and the people's happiness from every military provocation of the U.S. imperialists and their allies to invade the DPRK including Pueblo incident in the 1960s and Panmunjom incident in the 1970s and firmly safeguarded socialism by conducting the Arduous March in the 1990s. All this was possible because the army and the people were equipped with the spirit of "A-match-for-a-hundred".
					
					 This spirit which recorded the history of socialist construction with victories and glory lives on, displaying ever greater vitality today when the Juche revolution has entered into another century of Juche.
					
					 No matter how the situation and the world political structure may change, the service persons, party members and other people remain unchanged in their will to fully defend the security of the country and the people's happiness by their own efforts.
					
					  It is necessary to settle accounts with the reckless enemies with arms, not with words.

articles.title: Some Member Nations of UNSC Accountable for Their Becoming Marionette of U.S.
articles.content:
Some Member Nations of UNSC Accountable for Their Becoming Marionette of U.S.
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and its allies are keeping utterly mum about Japan's launch of a spy satellite though they made much fuss about the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 Japan's spy satellite launch poses a serious problem. Japan is a war criminal state and, at the same time, it is a dangerous state as it gives spurs to its militarization while denying its past crimes, defying the demand of the international community. Japan is regarded as a target of vigilance in the international community because of its moral vulgarity and shamefulness.
					
					 Some countries in the world are airing their concern about Japan's spy satellite launch, expressing hope that it would neither spark off a vicious cycle nor give unnecessary impetus. Among them are passive onlookers to Japan's spy satellite launch. What type of world is the United Nations Security Council making?
					
					 The world is by no means the one for the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. tries to handle international issues in line with its strategy for domination from the standpoint of its interests, styling itself the "only superpower in the world" as it did in the past. Many countries know well about this but they are allowing the U.S. application of its double standards, taken in by its trick. 
					
					 It is a well-known fact that the U.S. handling of issues according to its biased and ambitious decision is rendering the overall international situation complicated. It is irresponsible for some countries to fail to handle issues properly, reading the U.S. face in violation of their principles.
					
					 They should feel responsibility for allowing the UNSC to be reduced to a marionette of the U.S. after losing its impartiality.
					
					 Steadfast are the stand and will of the DPRK to legitimately exercise its right to launch satellites no matter what others may say, the commentary declares, urging the U.S. and its allies not to expect the DPRK to do anything contrary to its principle.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces Lee Myung Bak's "Special Amnesty"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces Lee Myung Bak's "Special Amnesty"
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Wednesday in a bylined commentary terms the "special amnesty" granted by Lee Myung Bak of south Korea to his close confidants unpardonable mockery and insult to the south Korean people.
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Lee's close confidants who had been behind bars are criminals who committed irregularities and corruption by abusing power.
					
					 Lee played such sleight of hand as including in the list of his "special amnesty" some of Ryongsan evacuees as well as pro-Park figures of "the Saenuri Party" under the signboard of "great unity of people" in an effort to release his close confidants from prison.
					
					 However, such artifice is not workable anywhere.
					
					 In south Korea there are not a few people who were arrested and thrown into prison while fighting for the democratization of society and national reunification. If Lee sincerely wants "great unity of people", he should set free more than 700 prisoners of conscience who had been jailed on charge of violating "the Security Law" and release every Ryongsan evacuee before any others. But he didn't pardon even a prisoner of conscience nor did set free all Ryongsan evacuees.
					
					 In a final analysis, Lee's inclusion of pro-Park figures and some Ryongsan evacuees in the list of "special amnesty" was not for achieving the "great unity of people" but for calming down resentment of the ruling party and the people.
					
					 It is nothing but Lee's daydream to prolong his remaining days by depending on his close confidants freed by him en masse this time, the commentary concludes.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Territorial Claim to Tok Islets
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts Japan's Territorial Claim to Tok Islets
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have become all the more assertive in their territorial claim to Tok Islets from the outset of the year.
					 There are open moves to set up an office exclusively dealing with Tok Islets issue within the government amid the claim that "it is necessary for a sovereign state to set up a system for imparting the territorial issue to the people at home and abroad".
					
					 There is a move to hold the event of "Day of Takeshima" slated for February 22 on a government level with the involvement of Prime Minister Abe and other cabinet ministers.
					
					 The Tokyo Metropolitan Education Committee plans to significantly increase the contents dealing with Tok Islets in history textbooks for senior high schools run by the metropolis from this year.
					
					 This is a shameless act that can be done by the Japanese reactionaries only.
					
					 Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory that have been possessed and controlled by the Koreans along with their time-honored history.
					
					 The islets are clearly specified as land of Korea in maps produced by European and U.S. scholars after the middle ages, to say nothing of Korea's state documents and historical data.
					
					 In January 1696 the Edo government of Japan admitted that Ullung Island and Tok Islets belonged to Korea. "Map of eastern coast of Korea" drawn by the Ministry of Navy of Japan in 1876 and maps of waterways drawn by the Bureau of Waterway of Japan and other Japanese maps that were produced till 1905 all marked Tok Islets as the territory of Korea. This proves that Tok Islets are part of the territory of Korea from the olden times.
					
					 Tok Islets are not territory whose owner is not clear as clamored by the Japanese reactionaries.
					
					 Japan makes a far-fetched assertion that the territory of Korea is its land. This despicable behavior is a hysterical fit of those obsessed by the territorial ambition.
					
					 By making the Japanese convince that Tok Islets are "land of Japan", Japan seeks to get them ready for the Korean war for the territorial expansion and turn those islets into an advanced base and a military bridgehead for realizing the territorial ambition and reinvading Korea. Herein lies Japan's sinister intention in persisting in its moves for grabbing Tok Islets.
					
					 By building up public opinion to make the international community convince in Japan's dominium over Tok Islets, Japan seeks to put not only the islets but the whole territory of Korea under its military control and realize its old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere."
					
					 Japan's bid to set up an office exclusively dealing with the Tok Islets issue within the government indicates that its moves to grab the islets have entered a more dangerous phase.
					
					 Japan's territorial claim to Tok Islets can never be tolerated as it is a criminal act of wantonly violating the dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					 Japan should stop the useless act, pondering over the serious consequences to be entailed by its reckless territorial ambition.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korean Joint Naval Maneuvers Assailed
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korean Joint Naval Maneuvers Assailed
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Papers here Wednesday carry bylined commentaries condemning the south Korean warmongers for kicking off joint naval exercises in the East Sea of Korea with the U.S. imperialist aggression forces on Monday.
					 Rodong Sinmun brands the drills as a curtain raiser to the scenario to unleash a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula under the pretext of the DPRK's retaliatory measure for self-defence. 
					
					 The on-going saber-rattling is fraught with increasing danger of war as the U.S. and south Korean warmongers are undisguisedly crying out for not ruling out military "sanctions" against the north, a nuclear-powered  carrier belonging  to the U.S. Seventh Fleet entered a south Korean port and it was announced that B-2 carrying nuclear bombs would be deployed on Guam. 
					
					 Such hysteric military racket is driving the situation on the peninsula into the worst phase.
					
					 The above-said facts clearly indicate that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group cooked up a "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK, groundlessly finding fault with its satellite launch, in order to attain their main purpose of provoking a war against it.
					
					 Their reckless military challenge only hardens the DPRK's will to wage a final battle for defending its sovereignty.
					
					 Minju Joson says: The trigger-happy forces of the U.S. and south Korea are foolishly showing off their military muscle to frighten the DPRK, but this will get them nowhere.
					
					 The DPRK is fully ready to react to their provocation with a prompt counter-strike, and to a war of aggression with a great war of justice for national reunification. This is its message to those keen to unleash a war against it.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage North-targeted War Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers Plan to Stage North-targeted War Drill
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The "Kyoljon" unit of the south Korean ground force announced that it would kick off a ground coordinated drill in the areas of Yangphyong and Ryoju, Kyonggi Province on Feb. 5, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 This military drill will reportedly be staged till Feb. 7 day and night for the purpose of improving the alert posture of the army and bolstering up its capability to carry out regular combat operations under the pretext of "provocation" from someone.
					
					 This drill envisages huge forces' mobile exercise to take a start line for attack.
					
					 The evermore undisguised saber-rattling of the warmongers goes to clearly prove that the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is desperately pursuing confrontation till the last moments of their office.

articles.title: Intensified Movement for Independent Reunification Called for
articles.content:
Intensified Movement for Independent Reunification Called for
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Organizations and figures of the movement for reunification and lawmakers from opposition parties of south Korea held a seminar in Seoul on Feb. 2 on the theme of intensified movement for independent reunification.
					 In order to strengthen the movement for independent reunification, it is necessary to take it as main tasks to thoroughly implement the south-north joint declarations, have a peace treaty concluded and stop joint military exercises, speakers said.
					
					 They stressed the need to have the "Security Law" abolished and the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea and conduct brisk activities for the study of the reunification issue.
					
					 They called for forming an organization for solidarity with the peace movement this year marking the 60th anniversary of the conclusion of the Armistice Agreement for the present and launch diverse movements for independent and peaceful reunification.

articles.title: Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification Meets
articles.content:
Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification Meets
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting of members and secretaries of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification took place in Tokyo on Feb. 1.
					 Present at the meeting were So Chung On, director of the Department for International Relations and Reunification Issue of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, and its members and secretaries.
					
					 So Chung On made an address at the meeting.
					
					 He denounced the U.S. and its allies for fabricating the United Nations Security Council "resolution on sanctions" banning the satellite launch for peaceful purposes, an exercise of the independent right of a sovereign state.
					
					 The DPRK declared it would take a resolute retaliatory step to cope with the prevailing situation, he noted.
					
					 He stressed that the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification would escalate the movement for national reunification this year.
					
					 Then followed a report by Ri Tong Je.
					
					 He underlined the need to give a definite priority to the political information service to open a new phase for national reunification this historical year marking the 65th anniversary of the DPRK and the 60th anniversary of the victorious Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 He said that it is necessary for the present to remove the confrontation between the north and the south and settle the reunification issue by concerted efforts of the Korean nation in an independent manner out of the stand of giving priority to the nation, attaching importance to the nation and achieving national unity.
					
					 He called for consolidating the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification and enhancing its role as required by the developing reunification movement.
					
					  Then followed speeches.
					
					  A resolution was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Collection of Kim Jong Un's Works Published by Regional Organization
articles.content:
Collection of Kim Jong Un's Works Published by Regional Organization
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- A collection of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's works was brought out by the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on January 29.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Tunisia
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Tunisia
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee to mark the 71st birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated in Tunisia on January 31.
					 The secretary general of the Tunisia-Korea Friendship Association was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 It decided to organize diverse political and cultural events such as seminar and film show on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Slovak Political Party Supports Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
articles.content:
Slovak Political Party Supports Kim Jong Un's New Year Address
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Slovak Communist Party sent a letter to the DPRK embassy in Bratislava on January 30 in support of the New Year Address made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 The letter said:
					
					 Comrade Kim Jong Un clarified the issues arising in achieving the reunification of the country including the defusing of the confrontation between the north and the south and thorough implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 As clarified by him, Korea's cause of reunification would be achieved by concerted efforts of all Koreans free from foreign interference.
					
					 He clarified his will to develop relations of friendship and cooperation with the countries that are friendly towards the DPRK out of their respect for its sovereignty, and safeguard regional peace and stability.
					
					 The Slovak Communist Party fully supports his New Year Address.
					
					 We wish him greater success in his noble work for defending peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and achieving Korea's reunification.

articles.title: British Organization Supports DPRK's Stance
articles.content:
British Organization Supports DPRK's Stance
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted an article titled "Korea does what it is determined to do" on its website on January 29.
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK's successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 on December 12 last year created a great stir worldwide.
					
					 When looking back on what happened in the past, the U.S.-led  imperialists used to bring each satellite launch of the DPRK up for discussion at the UNSC as if something serious had occurred, kicking up "sanctions" racket.
					
					 The same thing happened when satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 was launched. 
					
					 The U.S., Japan, south Korea and others termed  the DPRK's satellite launch a violation of the UNSC's "resolution", "long-range missile launch for military purposes" and "provocation," straining the situation again.
					
					 But the DPRK launched the satellite as it determined, remaining undeterred.
					
					 Its latest satellite launch demonstrated before the international community that Korea does what it is determined to do.
					
					 Such mettle of the DPRK was not displayed during its latest satellite launch only. The DPRK had access to nuclear deterrent for self-defence to cope with the nuclear threat of the U.S., and the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK dealt retaliatory blows at the south Korean puppet forces who fired shells into its inviolable territorial waters.
					
					 Meanwhile, the website in an article titled "The U.S. should not forget the lesson taught by the 'Pueblo' armed spy ship incident" recalled that the U.S. imperialists apologized to the army and people of the DPRK, yielding to their demands after committing such provocation as illegally intruding into the territorial waters of the DPRK.
					
					 The article stressed that the DPRK recognized by the world as a military power and nuclear weapons state has military capabilities strong enough to deal prompt and merciless blows at any invaders no matter where they are if they intrude into its territory, territorial waters and air even an inch.

articles.title: Foreigners Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
articles.content:
Foreigners Praise Kim Jong Il's Exploits
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between January 28 and February 4 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included a seminar, photo exhibition and film show in Nepal, meeting and seminar in Germany and a week of photo exhibition in Democratic Congo.
					
					 Darmendra Raj Bastala, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist), prayed for the immortality of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people could defend socialism and hasten the building of an economic giant despite the moves of the U.S., chieftain of world imperialism, and its lackeys Japan and the south Korean puppet regime, to stifle the DPRK thanks to the clear way indicated by Kim Jong Il, he noted, and continued:
					
					 Our party and progressives in Nepal will always extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle and stand up against the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Speakers including the organizational secretary of the German Branch of the Korean Friendship Association praised Kim Jong Il for frustrating all moves of the imperialists, honorably defending the country and the revolution and providing a firm guarantee for building a thriving nation with his energetic Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo and vice-chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, stressed that thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the DPRK could demonstrate its might as a country of single-minded unity which achieved a harmonious whole between the leader and people, an invincible power having nuclear deterrent.

articles.title: UNSC's "Resolution on Sanctions" against DPRK Denounced
articles.content:
UNSC's "Resolution on Sanctions" against DPRK Denounced
						
 Pyongyang, February 6 (KCNA) -- Ecuadorian and Indonesian organizations released statements on Jan. 31 in denunciation of the unjust "resolution" of the United Nations Security Council which took issue with the DPRK's legitimate satellite launch. 
					 The Federation of University Students of Ecuador said as follows:
					
					 We pay high respects to Marshal Kim Jong Un who is victoriously leading the Korean revolution while frustrating the hostile forces' moves of abusing the UNSC to step up anti-DPRK campaign. We also extend firm solidarity to the dignified Korean people.
					
					 The heroic DPRK can not be subject to "sanctions". It enjoys warm congratulations from the world people for achieving great successes in developing the cutting-edge science and technology and advancing socialist cause to victory. 
					
					 We strongly denounce all sorts of anti-DPRK moves of the UNSC and imperialists which violate the sovereignty of the DPRK. 
					
					 We will resolutely turn out to increase voices of support and solidarity for the DPRK, beacon of the human cause of independence. 
					
					 The Indonesian Federation of Transport Workers Unions said the scientific development of space is not a monopoly of some countries, adding international law does not specify certain countries which are allowed to launch satellites for space development. 
					
					 We warmly congratulate once again the DPRK on its successful launch of satellite by its own efforts and with indigenous technology.
					
					 The unjust "resolution on sanctions" of the UNSC against the DPRK must be withdrawn and the "UN Command" in south Korea be dissolved at once.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente mexicano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente mexicano
						
Pyongyang, 6 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo de muchas perdidas humanas causadas por una explosion recien ocurrida en una compania petrolera situada en la ciudad de Mexico, el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 5 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos, Enrique Pena Nieto.
					El remitente expresa en su mensaje profunda compasion y condolencias al destinatario, a las victimas y sus familiares.

articles.title: Otorgados a intelectuales ameritados titulos academicos y grados docents
articles.content:
Otorgados a intelectuales ameritados titulos academicos y grados docentes
						
Pyongyang, 6 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de natalicio del Dirigente Kim Jong Il (16 de febrero), fueron otorgados a los intelectuales de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea los titulos academicos y grados docentes.
					Quedaron concedidos el titulo de academico a Kim Song Gun, investigador del instituto de cesped de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, y a Kim Kwon Mu, investigador del instituto de selvicultura del Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental, y el titulo de candidato al academico a Kim Song Il, jefe de catedra de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					
					Jo Chol, vicerrector de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Pak Je Dong, jefe de seccion de la Universidad de Economia Nacional, Ri Kyong Su, investigador de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, y otros recibieron el grado docente de profesor titular.
					
					Quedaron otorgados el grado de doctor a 38 personas incluyendo Yun Nam, jefe de catedra de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, Kim Ryong Hwa, jefe de la catedra de la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek, y Ryom Song Chol, investigador del instituto de matematica de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, y el grado docente de candidato al profesor titular a 127 personas.
					
					Ellos contribuyeron grandemente a la construccion de un Estado prospero al esforzarse por conquistar la  tecnologia de punta en acato a la idea del Mariscal Kim Jong Un de dar prioridad a ciencias y tecnologias.
					
					La ceremonia de otorgamiento tuvo lugar el dia 6 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo.

articles.title: Prosigue la oleada humana a la casa natal de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Prosigue la oleada humana a la casa natal de Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, 6 de febrero (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de la Estrella Luz (16 de febrero, cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il), crece el numero de visitantes a su casa natal en el campamento secreto del monte Paektu.
					Entre ellos se distinguen los militares, jovenes, trabajadores, ninos escolares y habitantes de otros estratos.
					
					Hace poco, tuvieron lugar en el patio de la casa natal los actos de juramento de los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea y de los integrantes de la caravana del Ministerio del Ferrocarril.
					
					Por otra parte, quedo iniciada la marcha al mismo destino de los propagandistas basicos ejemplares de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.
					
					Pasando revista a los valiosos objetos exhibidos en la casa natal, los caravanistas recuerdan los dias en que el Dirigente nacio y crecio ahi como hijo de la guerrilla y se sienten orgullosos de integrar la nacion del Sol que tiene de generacion en generacion la fortuna de contar con excelentes lideres y generales.
					
					Redoblan la conviccion y voluntad de llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche apoyando el centro de unidad y direccion y continuando el espiritu de la unidad monolitica y el linaje del Paektu.
					
					El campamento secreto del monte Paektu fue acondicionado en la segunda mitad de la decada de 1930 por el Presidente Kim Il Sung como base central de la direccion sobre la revolucion coreana y del grueso del Ejercito Revolucionario Popular de Corea.
					
					Desde que fuera inaugurado el 11 de febrero del 76 (1987) de la Era Juche en su estado original, lo visitaron hasta la fecha millones de habitantes, coreanos residentes en ultramar, surcoreanos y extranjeros.

articles.title: ACNC comenta ambicion de reaccionarios japoneses de arrebatar islote Tok
articles.content:
ACNC comenta ambicion de reaccionarios japoneses de arrebatar islote Tok
						
Pyongyang, 6 de febrero (ACNC) -- Desde el principio del Ano Nuevo, los reaccionarios de Japon se mueven ajetreados para usurpar el islote Tok.
					Bajo el pretexto de "como Estado soberano, hay que establecer el sistema de planteamiento del problema de territorio al interior y exterior del pais", ellos tratan de instaurar en el gobierno una oficina encargada del problema del islote Tok.
					
					A fin de conceder el nivel gubernamental al acto por "Dia de Takeshima" (nombre japones del mismo islote) a realizarse el dia 22 que viene, quieren incluir en la lista de participantes al premier Abe y los ministros.
					
					Por otra parte, el comite de ensenanza de la metropoli de Tokio planea aumentar notablemente desde el presente ano los parrafos sobre el islote Tok en el manual de historia para la escuela superior de metropoli.
					
					Es otro acto cinico de que son capaces unicamente los reaccionarios japoneses.
					
					El islote en cuestion es territorio intocable de Corea desde la remota antiguedad.
					
					Los documentos y los datos de historia de Corea y la mayoria de mapas fabricados por los cientificos europeos y estadounidenses despues de la Edad Media ponen en claro la soberania de Corea sobre el Tok. 
					
					Ademas, en enero de 1696, el gobierno de Edo de Japon reconocio que la isla Ullung y el islote Tok pertenecen a Corea.
					
					El "mapa de la costa del Mar Este de Corea", elaborado por el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Maritimas de Japon, el "mapa de rutas maritimas de Corea", por la Direccion de Hidrografia, y los otros mapas hechos en Japon hasta 1905 incluyen tambien el Tok al territorio jurisdiccional de Corea. Sin embargo, los reaccionarios japoneses dicen ahora que el Tok es un territorio de dudosa propiedad.
					
					Las obstinadas tentativas de despojar el Tok parten de la siniestra intencion de hacer creer a los habitantes japoneses que eso es "tierra japonesa", prepararlos para la guerra de expansion territorial, o sea, la guerra coreana, y convertir el islote en una base avanzada donde se lanzaria la nueva agresion.
					
					Ademas, al inventar en la sociedad internacional la opinion a favor de la soberania japonesa sobre el Tok, tratan de llevar a la realidad su anejado sueno de la "Esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental" ocupando esa y todas las demas partes del territorio coreano.
					
					Tales acciones violan flagrantemente la dignidad y la soberania de Corea.
					
					Japon debe suspender ahora mismo su imprudente campana para arrebatar el territorio ajeno meditando seriamente en sus graves consecuencias.
